title: Sketchbook Folio, "The Rape of the Sabines", 1821–22
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white heavy wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at center left: Lodovico Caracci Bologna; at lower left: 41 Lodovico Caracci Bologna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper drawing of struggle between women and classically dressed warriors. Lower drawing of man crawling at center being slain by Romulus and Remus, one with spear other with sword. At middleground two warriors, one with shield, kneel before altar. Figures and city wall in background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sketchbook Folio, "The Rape of the Sabines", 1821–22.
1821–22. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white heavy wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3579.
